verses.text: Whoso loveth instruction loveth knowledge : but he that hateth reproof \add is\add* brutish.
A good \add man\add* obtaineth favour of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*: but a man of wicked devices will he condemn.
A man shall not be established by wickedness : but the root of the righteous shall not be moved.
A virtuous woman \add is\add* a crown to her husband : but she that maketh ashamed \add is\add* as rottenness in his bones.
The thoughts of the righteous \add are\add* right : \add but\add* the counsels of the wicked \add are\add* deceit.
The words of the wicked \add are\add* to lie in wait for blood : but the mouth of the upright shall deliver them.
The wicked are overthrown , and \add are\add* not: but the house of the righteous shall stand.
A man shall be commended according to his wisdom : but he that is of a perverse heart shall be despised.\f + \fr 12.8 \ft of a…: Heb. perverse of heart\f*
\add He that is\add* despised , and hath a servant , \add is\add* better than he that honoureth himself, and lacketh bread.
A righteous \add man\add* regardeth the life of his beast : but the tender mercies of the wicked \add are\add* cruel.\f + \fr 12.10 \ft tender…: or, bowels\f*
He that tilleth his land shall be satisfied with bread : but he that followeth vain \add persons is\add* void of understanding.
The wicked desireth the net of evil \add men:\add* but the root of the righteous yieldeth \add fruit\add*.\f + \fr 12.12 \ft the net: or, the fortress\f*

The wicked is snared by the transgression of \add his\add* lips : but the just shall come out of trouble.\f + \fr 12.13 \ft The wicked…: Heb. The snare of the wicked is in the transgression of lips\f*
A man shall be satisfied with good by the fruit of \add his\add* mouth : and the recompence of a man’s hands shall be rendered unto him.
The way of a fool \add is\add* right in his own eyes : but he that hearkeneth unto counsel \add is\add* wise.
A fool’s wrath is presently known : but a prudent \add man\add* covereth shame.\f + \fr 12.16 \ft presently: Heb. in that day\f*
\add He that\add* speaketh truth sheweth forth righteousness : but a false witness deceit.
There is that speaketh like the piercings of a sword : but the tongue of the wise \add is\add* health.
The lip of truth shall be established for ever : but a lying tongue \add is\add* but for a moment.
Deceit \add is\add* in the heart of them that imagine evil : but to the counsellors of peace \add is\add* joy.
There shall no evil happen to the just : but the wicked shall be filled with mischief.
Lying lips \add are\add* abomination to the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*: but they that deal truly \add are\add* his delight.
A prudent man concealeth knowledge : but the heart of fools proclaimeth foolishness.
The hand of the diligent shall bear rule : but the slothful shall be under tribute.\f + \fr 12.24 \ft slothful: or, deceitful\f*
Heaviness in the heart of man maketh it stoop : but a good word maketh it glad.
The righteous \add is\add* more excellent than his neighbour : but the way of the wicked seduceth them.\f + \fr 12.26 \ft excellent: or, abundant\f*
The slothful \add man\add* roasteth not that which he took in hunting : but the substance of a diligent man \add is\add* precious.
In the way of righteousness \add is\add* life ; and \add in\add* the pathway \add thereof there is\add* no death.
